alert.note: Alert for Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 12:32PM MDT until May 07 at 9:59AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. For the St. Joe River...including Calder, St Maries...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at Calder. * WHEN...From this morning to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Bear Creek will begin to back up from the St Joe River and may start to spill into the town of Calder, flooding the low spots in yards, roads and parking lots. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PDT Friday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon St Joe River Calder 13.0 12.4 Fri 10 am PD 12.6 12.3 11.7 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM PDT.
